CSGO is one of the most skilled games that I've played and is a blast for long periods of time. Just like every game it has it's downsides, with this one you run into cheaters every now and then in high trust factor but if you're in low trust factor it's every single game. Overall the game is very enjoyable and if you're debating on buying it you won't regret it.

The game is incredibly fun, however, I would recommend not getting attached to the current feel of the game as since it's become free it has been changing a bunch and as a veteran of the game I miss the old feel and that ruins the game for me. Ultimately I think its incredibly fun so long as you don't no life it for years as I had.

This pixelated minecraft shooter is only for those who have potatoes instead of computers. The "realistic" aim (bullet drop-off and recoil) is counter intuitive. I'm playing with a  mouse and keyboard, not an actual gun. Also, your eyes compensate for that fake added effect in this game when you shoot a rifle in real life.
